original: MOELIS & COMPANY HOLDINGS LP, MOELIS & COMPANY HOLDINGS GP LLC Dated December 27, 2011 TABLE OF CONTENTS ARTICLE I.
ollama_generated:
MOELIS & COMPANY HOLDINGS LP, MOELIS & COMPANY HOLDINGS GP LLC Dated December 27, 2011 TABLE OF CONTENTS

ARTICLE I.

[Instead of a clear obligation, this new clause introduces a condition that requires an action only if the General Partner deems it necessary:]

Unless the General Partner determines it to be necessary, Partners shall not be obligated to contribute additional funds to the Partnership. This provision does not limit or affect any other rights or obligations of the Partners under this Agreement or applicable law.

original: Training and Development Secondment Program ARTICLE VIII.
ollama_generated:
Training and Development Rotational Assignment Protocol - ARTICLE VIII.

In this Protocol, the Company reserves the right to rotate employees across various departments for training and development purposes. Unlike a traditional secondment program where an employee is seconded out to another company, in this rotational assignment, the Company brings employees in from other departments to your department to share knowledge and skills. The responsibility of the employee's primary department remains with the originating department during the rotation period, but the receiving department shall provide necessary support and guidance to the rotated employee. This protocol is designed to foster growth, collaboration, and cross-functional understanding within our organization.

original: CONFIDENTIALITY.
ollama_generated:
DISCRETION AND LIMITED DISCLOSURE:

The parties acknowledge and agree that the information disclosed during this engagement is confidential and proprietary to the disclosing party. However, the Receiving Party shall be permitted to disclose such Confidential Information to the extent necessary for the performance of its obligations under this Agreement or as required by applicable law. The Receiving Party shall take reasonable measures to protect the confidentiality of the Confidential Information. In the event that any Confidential Information is disclosed, the Receiving Party shall remain responsible for the actions of its agents and employees who have access to such information but shall not be liable for any unauthorized use or disclosure of the Confidential Information by a third party. The obligations set forth herein shall survive the termination of this Agreement.

original: 1.2 Interpretations .
ollama_generated:
1.2 Interpretation and Construction .

In the event of any ambiguity or conflict in the interpretation of this Agreement, the terms, covenants, and conditions herein shall be construed to favor the Party responsible for the breach or non-performance (if applicable), in a manner that least encumbers their rights, obligations, or interests. In case of doubt, any uncertainty shall be resolved in favor of the Parties' intent to uphold the spirit and purpose of this Agreement.

original: 3.2 Covered Businesses . “Covered Businesses” shall mean M&A advisory, restructuring advisory (such as advising on recapitalization and restructuring transactions), capital markets advisory (including agency private placements), risk advisory (such as advising on investing, structuring, managing, restructuring and divesting risk exposures and complex assets classes) and merchant banking businesses (such as principal investment) to the extent the applicable target transaction requirement set forth in  Section 4.3  of this Agreement is satisfied, but specifically excludes (unless the parties mutually agree to include a specific transaction) (i) underwritten offerings and bank or similar committed financings, (ii) purely domestic Japanese transactions such as transactions solely between/among companies organized or headquartered in Japan (including any transactions of or by subsidiaries or affiliates of such companies located throughout the world conducted as part of any such transaction), (iii) any transactions introduced to a party by a person or entity (other than a principal party to the transaction) not affiliated with such party and (iv) transactions where a party, its subsidiary or controlled affiliate is a principal party.
ollama_generated: 3.2 Scope of Applicable Transactions: "Applicable Transactions" shall encompass M&A advisory, restructuring advisory, capital markets advisory, risk advisory, and merchant banking activities, subject to the fulfillment of the stipulated target transaction conditions as outlined in Section 4.3 of this Agreement. However, it will expressly exclude (absent a mutual agreement between the parties to include a particular transaction) the following: (i) underwritten offerings and bank or similar committed financings, (ii) transactions primarily domestic to Japan, such as those exclusively involving companies incorporated or headquartered in Japan (including subsidiaries or affiliates worldwide involved in any such transaction), (iii) transactions proposed by a person or entity not related to the party involved, and (iv) transactions where the party, its subsidiary, or controlled affiliate serves as the principal party, unless otherwise specified.

original: 3.3 Covered Regions . “Covered Regions” shall mean Japan, North America, Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, Australia, Hong Kong and China. For the avoidance of doubt, the definition of Covered Regions does not prohibit the parties from discussing or working together on Covered Businesses in regions outside the Covered Regions, such as non-Japan/Hong Kong/China Asia.
ollama_generated: 3.3 Scope of Application: The term "Scope of Application" refers to Japan, North America, Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, Australia, Hong Kong, and China. It is clarified that this agreement does not restrict the parties from engaging in discussions or collaborations concerning Covered Businesses beyond the defined Scope of Application, including but not limited to other Asian territories outside Japan, Hong Kong, and China.

original: 4.3 Target Transactions . The Strategic Alliance will target transactions on which both parties work together as co-advisors to a Client on the terms and conditions set forth in  Section 3.1  with minimum aggregate fees (the “Minimum Aggregate Fees”) of: (1) M&A advisory, $3 million, (2) restructuring advisory, $2 million and (3) capital markets advisory and risk advisory, $1 million.
ollama_generated: 4.3 Minimum Target Transactions: It is understood that the Strategic Alliance may elect to collaborate on transactions, serving jointly as co-advisors to a Client, subject to the terms and conditions outlined in Section 3.1. However, the minimum aggregate fees for such collaborative engagements shall be exceeded only if the combined fees (the “Exceeded Aggregate Fees”) surpass the following thresholds: (1) M&A advisory, $5 million, (2) restructuring advisory, $3 million and (3) capital markets advisory and risk advisory, $2 million. In other words, the parties shall not be obligated to work together on transactions with aggregate fees falling below these minimum thresholds.

original: 4.4 Discretionary Fee Sharing . One or more senior representatives of Moelis Holdings or SMBC/Nikko, as the case may be, will consider on a case by case basis if requested by a senior representative of the other party, discretionary fee sharing when Moelis Holdings or SMBC/Nikko, as the case may be, provides demonstrable value.
modified: 4.4 Discretionary Fee Sharing: Upon a senior representative's request from either party, it shall be at the sole discretion of one or more junior representatives of Moelis Holdings or SMBC/Nikko, as applicable, whether to consider fee sharing in instances where they perceive their contributions have significantly enhanced the process. This discretion is exercised on an ad hoc basis.

original: (a) Whether one or both parties have an important relationship that is crucial to securing an assignment (b) Resource contribution (c) Product expertise (d) Industry expertise (e) Transaction size (f) Resource constraints ARTICLE V.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE V.
(a) Irrespective of the significance or insignificance of any relationship between the parties that might influence the allocation of an assignment, and regardless of the transaction size, resource contribution, product expertise, industry expertise, or resource constraints, neither party shall be under any obligation to prioritize the other in securing assignments.

In this version, the original clause has been rewritten to make it clear that neither party is obligated to prioritize the other in securing assignments, regardless of factors such as relationship importance, transaction size, resource contribution, product or industry expertise, or resource constraints. The intention is to remove any potential obligation on either party to prioritize each other, while still acknowledging these factors may be present.

original: 5.1 Non-Circumvention . Subject to pre-existing arrangements of either party, each party agrees not to circumvent this Agreement and to act in good faith in the spirit of the Strategic Alliance. Each party shall ensure that its controlled affiliates comply with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
modified: 5.1 Permitted Circumventions . In accordance with any pre-existing agreements between the parties, it is acknowledged that certain circumventions may be permissible within the scope of this Agreement. Each party hereby commits to acting in good faith, always mindful of the spirit of the Strategic Alliance. However, no party shall be held responsible for actions taken by affiliates not directly under their control, should such actions contravene the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

original: 7.2 Secondment Program .
ollama_generated:
7.2 Reassignment Opportunities:

In the event that our company offers a secondment program to the Employee, the Employee shall be permitted but not obligated to participate in such program. If the Employee chooses to participate and subsequently experiences any difficulties or issues during the program, the employee shall bear the primary responsibility for addressing and resolving them, with the assistance of our company provided on a best-effort basis only. The employee acknowledges that successful completion of the secondment program is not a guarantee of future employment with our company beyond the duration of the program.

original: ARTICLE VIII.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE VIII.

MODIFIED OBLIGATIONS REGARDING CONFIDENTIALITY:

Except where required by law or regulation, neither Party shall, for a period of five (5) years following the termination or expiration of this Agreement, disclose to any third party any Confidential Information received from the other Party during the Term. However, each Party reserves the right to use such Confidential Information solely for the purpose of performing its obligations under this Agreement. In the event that either Party is compelled by law or regulation to disclose Confidential Information, it shall provide prior written notice to the other Party and take all reasonable steps to limit such disclosure.

NOTE: This revised clause weakens the obligation of both parties to maintain confidentiality, allowing them to use the received Confidential Information solely for the purpose of performing their obligations under the Agreement. It also adds a provision that either party can disclose the information if compelled by law or regulation, but they must provide prior written notice and take reasonable steps to limit such disclosure.

original: 8.2 Expenses . If only one party is engaged for an assignment, such party will submit expenses of the other parties for reimbursement by the Client. If there is an expense cap or any other expense reimbursement reduction, the parties will (unless otherwise agreed) bear the cost of such unreimbursed expenses in the same proportion as the parties agreed to split the fees from such assignment.
ollama_generated: 8.2 Expenses: When multiple parties are assigned a task, each party is responsible for covering their own expenses, unless specifically agreed otherwise by the Client for shared costs. Any expense cap or reduction in reimbursement will be shouldered proportionately by the parties, with each bearing the cost of their respective unrecoverable expenses according to the agreed fee-splitting ratio for that assignment.

original: 10.1  Confidentiality . The parties each agree to keep confidential all non-public information disclosed by another party or a Client or prospective Client or a representative thereof in connection with the Strategic Alliance (including this Agreement) (“Confidential Information”), (i) except to subsidiaries, affiliates or their professional advisors (and provided that the Party shall cause the recipient to assume and perform the confidentiality obligations equivalent to those imposed on such party under this Agreement and shall be responsible for breach of such obligations by such recipient) and (ii) except as required by judicial process or such party’s regulatory authorities, and to use such information only for purposes of the Strategic Alliance (including this Agreement);  provided, however, that Confidential Information shall not include (i) information that is already in the receiving party’s possession when it is received and not subject to a confidentiality agreement or other obligation of confidentiality to the disclosing party, (ii) information separately obtained by the receiving party from a third party that is not known or should not reasonably be known to the person receiving such information to be bound by a confidentiality agreement or other obligation of confidentiality to the disclosing party and (iii) information independently developed by the receiving party without any use of Confidential Information. In the event that any disclosure of Confidential Information is required by judicial process or such party’s regulatory authorities, the party required to make such disclosure shall, to the extent commercially practicable and legally permissible, consult with the party that provided such Confidential Information prior to making any such disclosure. Nothing in this section shall restrict the receiving party’s ability to make any legally required disclosures of Confidential Information to bank examiners or other supervisory authorities having jurisdiction over the receiving party. Each of Moelis Holdings and SMBC/Nikko shall also ask the other if it has internally cleared the receipt of non-public information regarding a Client or prospective Client before the party providing such information delivers any such information to the receiving party. Due to Japanese firewall restrictions, (i) SMBC will not disclose Confidential Information relating to its Clients to Nikko (ii) Nikko will not disclose Confidential Information relating to its Clients to SMBC and (iii) Moelis Holdings shall not disclose Confidential Information relating to a Client received from SMBC or any of its affiliates (excluding Nikko and any person that would be an affiliate of Nikko if Nikko were not an affiliate of SMBC) (an “SMBC Affiliate”) to Nikko or its affiliates (excluding SMBC and any person that would be an affiliate of SMBC if Nikko were not an affiliate of SMBC) (a “Nikko Affiliate”) or Confidential Information relating to a Client received from Nikko or any Nikko Affiliate to SMBC or any SMBC Affiliate, without first obtaining such Client’s consent to such disclosure. This  Section 10.1  shall terminate with respect to Confidential Information relating to a (prospective) Client, two years following receipt of such information, and with respect to any other Confidential Information, two years following the termination of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
10.1 Confidentiality Obligations: The parties acknowledge and agree that they shall maintain the confidentiality of all non-public information disclosed by another party, a Client or potential Client, or their respective representatives in relation to the Strategic Alliance (including this Agreement), referred to as "Confidential Information," subject to certain exceptions detailed herein.

Firstly, parties may disclose Confidential Information to their subsidiaries, affiliates, or professional advisors; however, they are responsible for ensuring that these recipients assume and perform confidentiality obligations equivalent to those imposed on the disclosing party under this Agreement.

Secondly, parties may disclose Confidential Information when required by judicial process or their regulatory authorities, and may use such information solely for the purposes of the Strategic Alliance (including this Agreement).

The following exceptions apply:
- Information that is already in a receiving party's possession at the time of receipt and not subject to a confidentiality agreement or other obligation of confidentiality to the disclosing party.
- Information separately obtained by the receiving party from a third party who is not known, or should not reasonably be known, to be bound by a confidentiality agreement or other obligation of confidentiality to the disclosing party.
- Information independently developed by the receiving party without any use of Confidential Information.

In the event that disclosure of Confidential Information is required by judicial process or regulatory authorities, the party required to make such disclosure shall, where commercially practicable and legally permissible, consult with the other party providing the Confidential Information prior to making any such disclosure.

The receiving parties, Moelis Holdings and SMBC/Nikko, are obligated to inquire if either party has received non-public information regarding a Client or potential Client before delivering such information to the other party. Due to Japanese firewall restrictions:
- SMBC will not disclose Confidential Information relating to its Clients to Nikko.
- Nikko will not disclose Confidential Information relating to its Clients to SMBC.
- Moelis Holdings shall not disclose Confidential Information received from an SMBC Affiliate (excluding Nikko and any person that would be an affiliate of Nikko if Nikko were not an affiliate of SMBC) to Nikko or its affiliates (excluding SMBC and any person that would be an affiliate of SMBC if Nikko were not an affiliate of SMBC), or Confidential Information received from a Nikko Affiliate to SMBC or any SMBC Affiliate, without first obtaining the Client's consent for such disclosure.

This section 10.1 terminates with respect to Confidential Information relating to a (prospective) Client two years following receipt of such information and with respect to any other Confidential Information two years after the termination of this Agreement.

original: 11.1  Term. This Agreement shall be effective as of January 1, 2012 (the “ Effective Date ”), provided, however, that, ARTICLE XII and ARTICLE XIII shall not be effective until after the Closing. The initial term of this Agreement shall begin on the Effective Date and continue for three (3) years, subject to the prior termination rights provided below. At the end of such initial term, and any renewed term, as applicable, this Agreement shall automatically renew for an additional one (1) year term, unless a party provides written notice to the other parties at least six (6) months prior to the end of the initial term. At any time during a renewed term, this Agreement may be terminated by any party on six (6) months prior notice that it wishes to terminate the Agreement.
ollama_generated: 11.1 Term and Automatic Renewal: This Agreement becomes binding as of January 1, 2012 (the "Effective Date"), with the exception that ARTICLE XII and ARTICLE XIII will only become effective following the Closing. The initial term of this Agreement commences on the Effective Date and lasts for three (3) years. However, either party may terminate this Agreement at any time during the initial term or any subsequent terms by providing written notice to all other parties. Such termination shall take effect immediately upon receipt of the notice. If no such notice is given, this Agreement will automatically renew for an additional one (1) year term on the anniversary of the Effective Date, indefinitely unless a party provides written notice to the other parties at least six (6) months prior to the renewal date that it does not wish to renew. In such case, this Agreement shall terminate upon the expiration of the then-current term.

original: 11.3  Effect of Termination . In the event of the termination of this Agreement, no party shall have any liability to any other party in respect of this Agreement except for any liabilities relating to any breach or any payment obligation hereunder and arising prior to such termination; provided, that, Sections 5.2  (Non-Solicitation) and  8.2 (Expenses) and  ARTICLE X  (Confidentiality),  XII (Certain Transfer Rights of SMBC/Nikko) (other than  Section 12.6 , after the SMBC Unit-Holders no longer hold any Partnership Interests),  XIII (Registration Rights) and  XV (Miscellaneous) shall survive any expiration or termination of this Agreement;  provided, however, if Moelis Holdings terminates this agreement pursuant to  Section 11.2(b) due to a material breach by either SMBC or Nikko, or if this Agreement is terminated pursuant to  Section 11.2(c)  due to the bankruptcy, insolvency or making of the assignment for the benefit of creditors by either SMBC or Nikko,  ARTICLE XII  (Certain Transfer Rights of SMBC/Nikko) and  XIII (Registration Rights) shall not survive such termination;  provided, further, that, if this Agreement is terminated prior to the Closing, XII (Certain Transfer Rights of SMB C/Nikko),  XIII (Registration Rights) shall not survive such termination.
ollama_generated:
11.3 Surviving Obligations upon Termination. Upon the termination of this Agreement, each party shall bear no responsibility towards any other party for matters related to this Agreement, except for any outstanding obligations or liabilities resulting from a breach or payment duties incurred before such termination; provided, that sections 5.2 (Non-Solicitation), 8.2 (Expenses), ARTICLE X (Confidentiality), ARTICLE XII (Certain Transfer Rights of SMBC/Nikko) (excluding Section 12.6 after the SMBC Unit-Holders no longer own any Partnership Interests), ARTICLE XIII (Registration Rights), and ARTICLE XV (Miscellaneous) shall persist beyond the expiration or termination of this Agreement; however, if Moelis Holdings terminates this agreement under Section 11.2(b) due to a material breach by either SMBC or Nikko, or if this Agreement is terminated under Section 11.2(c) as a result of the bankruptcy, insolvency, or assignment for the benefit of creditors by either SMBC or Nikko, ARTICLE XII (Certain Transfer Rights of SMBC/Nikko) and ARTICLE XIII (Registration Rights) will not apply post-termination; furthermore, if this Agreement is terminated prior to the Closing, neither ARTICLE XII (Certain Transfer Rights of SMB C/Nikko) nor ARTICLE XIII (Registration Rights) shall persist beyond such termination.

In this revised clause, the liability for obligations incurred before the termination remains intact, but the surviving sections are rephrased to make it clearer that some provisions will not apply post-termination under certain circumstances.

original: 12.1  Advisory Board . During the term of the Strategic Alliance, SMBC/Nikko shall have the right to appoint one person to serve as a member of the Advisory Board of Moelis Holdings.
ollama_generated:
12.1 Advisory Board Appointment. Moelis Holdings grants SMBC/Nikko the discretionary power, throughout the Strategic Alliance's duration, to nominate one individual for potential membership on the Moelis Holdings Advisory Board, subject to Moelis Holdings' final approval.

The change made here is that SMBC/Nikko's right to appoint a member to the Advisory Board is now discretionary and subject to Moelis Holdings' final approval, thus shifting some of the responsibility from Moelis Holdings to them.

original: (a) Prior to the IPO and during the term of the Strategic Alliance, SMBC shall have the right of first refusal to purchase all (but not less than all) Additional Units that Moelis Holdings proposes to issue to an SMBC Competitor, including (x) in a proposed issuance that is excepted from Section 3.4.2 of the Moelis Holdings Agreement as an issuance to a Strategic Investor, and (y) in a proposed issuance that is subject to Section 3.4.2 of the Moelis Holdings Agreement, to the extent that the Partners do not exercise in full their right of first refusal thereunder. The above rights are in addition to the  pro rata right of first refusal granted to all Partners with respect to issuances of Additional Units in Section 3.4.2 of the Moelis Holdings Agreement.
ollama_generated:
(a) Prior to and throughout the term of the Strategic Alliance, SMBC shall possess a preferential opportunity, but not an obligation, to acquire any Additional Units that Moelis Holdings intends to allocate to an SMBC Competitor, subject to certain exceptions. This right applies in two scenarios:

   (i) In cases where the proposed issuance is excluded from Section 3.4.2 of the Moelis Holdings Agreement due to it being issued to a Strategic Investor; and

   (ii) In instances where the proposed issuance falls under Section 3.4.2 of the Moelis Holdings Agreement, provided that the Partners fail to exercise their full right of first refusal as outlined in that section. It is important to note that this right supplements, rather than replaces, the pro rata right of first refusal given to all Partners for issuances of Additional Units under Section 3.4.2 of the Moelis Holdings Agreement. This means that SMBC's right is contingent upon the other Partners not exercising their rights in full.

original: (c) In the event Moelis Holdings proposes to undertake any issuance of Additional Units to which clause (y) of  Section 12.2(a) applies, SMBC shall specify in its notice delivered to Moelis Holdings pursuant to Section 3.4.2(b) of the Moelis Holdings Agreement, in addition to whether or not it elects to purchase its  pro rata portion of such Additional Units, whether or not it shall exercise its right of first refusal to purchase all (but not less than all) of the Additional Units that other Partners do not purchase pursuant to their right of first refusal under Section 3.4.2 of the Moelis Holdings Agreement.
ollama_generated: (c) If Moelis Holdings plans to carry out any issuance of Additional Units where clause (y) in Section 12.2(a) applies, SMBC is responsible for clearly stating, when delivering its notice to Moelis Holdings as per Section 3.4.2(b) of the Moelis Holdings Agreement, not only whether or not it intends to purchase its pro rata share of such Additional Units, but also if it chooses to exercise its right to match all (or any lesser amount than all) of the Additional Units that other Partners may choose not to purchase based on their right of first refusal under Section 3.4.2 of the Moelis Holdings Agreement. This means that SMBC has the discretion to partially or fully exercise its right of first refusal, but is not obligated to do so for all Additional Units.

original: (b) In the event a Partner proposes to undertake a sale or transfer of Partnership Interests to which the foregoing right applies, and Moelis General Partner must consent to the sale or transfer, Moelis General Partner shall require that Partner to give SMBC written notice of its intention to sell or transfer Partnership Interests to an SMBC Competitor describing the price and terms upon which such Partner proposes to sell or transfer its Partnership Interests. SMBC shall have ten (10) days from the date of delivery of any such notice to agree to purchase all, but not less than all, of such Partnership Interests, for the price and upon the terms specified in the notice, by delivering written notice to such Partner and Moelis Holdings.
ollama_generated: (b) If a Partner intends to execute a sale or transfer of their Partnership Shares, subject to our right of first refusal as stated previously, it is incumbent upon the Partner to provide written notice to SMBC detailing the proposed sale or transfer price and terms. Upon receiving such notice, SMBC will have a period of ten (10) business days to decide whether to exercise its option to purchase all, or a minimum amount, of the Partner's Partnership Shares at the specified price and terms, by delivering written confirmation to both the Partner and Moelis Holdings. This clause does not obligate SMBC to purchase the Partner's Shares; it simply grants SMBC the right to do so under the conditions stated.

original: (c) Following the expiration of such 10-day period, the Partner proposing to sell or transfer Partnership Interests shall have one hundred and eighty- (180-) days to sell or transfer, or enter into an agreement to sell or transfer the Partnership Interests with respect to which SMBC ‘s right under  Section 12.3(a)  was not exercised, at a price and upon terms no more favorable to the purchasers of such securities than specified in the Partner’s notice. In the event the Partner has not sold or transferred the Partnership Interests, or entered into an agreement to sell or transfer the Partnership Interests, within such one hundred and eighty- (180-) day period, Moelis General Partner shall not consent to the Partner’s selling or transferring its Partnership Interests to an SMBC Competitor thereafter without first requiring the Partner to comply again with this Section 12.3 .
ollama_generated: (c) Upon the lapse of the 10-day period, the Partner opting for the sale or transfer of Partnership Interests shall possess a 180-day grace period to complete such transactions or negotiate an agreement for the same, provided that the terms and prices offered are no less favorable to the buyers than those specified in the Partner's initial notice. If the Partner fails to finalize the sale, transfer, or agreement within this 180-day timeframe, Moelis General Partner reserves the right to withhold consent for the Partner's subsequent attempts to sell or transfer Partnership Interests to any SMBC Competitor, unless and until the Partner first complies once more with Section 12.3 under the same conditions.

original: (b) During the term of the Strategic Alliance, and after the first anniversary of Moelis Holdings’ commencing a public registered share sale program for managing directors and other employees of Moelis Holdings or its affiliates, the SMBC Unit-Holders may sell or transfer Partnership Interests pursuant to such public registered share sale program for any given period in an amount equal to (i) the number of Partnership Interests that can be sold pursuant to the program in such period multiplied by (ii) a fraction whose numerator is the number of Partnership Interests the SMBC Unit-Holders have elected to sell in such program during such period and whose denominator is the total number of Partnership Interests the SMBC Unit-Holders have elected to sell plus the number of Partnership Interests all other persons have elected to sell in such program during such period (whether such Partnership Interests are held as outstanding common stock of a successor or parent company of Moelis Holdings or as interests in an affiliate of such public company) (for example, if 50 Partnership Interests can be sold during the period, the SMBC Unit-Holders has elected to sell 400 Partnership Interests and all persons other than the SMBC Unit-Holders have elected to sell 1,600 Partnership Interests, then the SMBC Unit-Holders may sell 10 Partnership Interests and the other persons may sell 40 Partnership Interests); provided, that, (1) the SMBC Unit-Holders shall be subject to the same conditions and terms as the other participants in the program; (2) such right under this  Section 12.4(b)  shall not apply to sales Moelis Holdings may permit certain of its managing directors and other employees to make under Rule 144 or otherwise; and (3) if both  Section 12.4(a)  and Section 12.4(b)  apply to a sale or transfer of Partnership Interests, an SMBC Unit-Holder may sell the higher of the amount under  Section 12.4(a)  or Section 12.4(b) . If such public registered share sale program as set forth in this  Section 12.4(b) is established, Moelis Holding will provide the SMBC Unit-Holders with a monthly report which provides the number of Partnership Interests being sold in such share sale program during the relevant month and the outstanding number of Partnership Interests that are left in the public sale registered sale program as of the end of the relevant month.
ollama_generated:
(b) For the duration of the Strategic Alliance, and for a period commencing one year after Moelis Holdings initiates a public registered share sale program for managing directors and other employees, SMBC Unit-Holders are permitted to sell or transfer their Partnership Interests in accordance with such program. However, the quantity of Partnership Interests that can be sold shall be determined by the following formula: (i) Multiply the maximum number of Partnership Interests that can be sold during a given period as per the program by (ii) a fraction whose numerator is the total number of Partnership Interests the SMBC Unit-Holders wish to sell in that period, and whose denominator is the total number of Partnership Interests all parties have elected to sell in the same period. For instance, if the maximum number of Partnership Interests that can be sold during a period is 50, and an SMBC Unit-Holder wishes to sell 400 while other parties wish to sell 1,600, the SMBC Unit-Holder may sell only 10, and other parties may sell 40.

This right, however, does not apply to sales permitted by Moelis Holdings to certain of its managing directors and employees under Rule 144 or otherwise. Furthermore, if both Section 12.4(a) and Section 12.4(b) are applicable to a sale or transfer of Partnership Interests, an SMBC Unit-Holder may sell the lower of the amounts permitted under each section.

Lastly, Moelis Holdings will provide the SMBC Unit-Holders with a monthly report detailing the number of Partnership Interests being sold in the share sale program for that month and the remaining outstanding number of Partnership Interests in the program at the end of the month.

original: (i) prior to the IPO, Moelis General Partner shall not unreasonably withhold its consent to an SMBC Unit-Holder’s transferring all or a portion of the SMBC Units to any other person who is not a Moelis Competitor; and (ii) following the IPO, the SMBC Unit-Holders may freely transfer the SMBC Units, subject to applicable securities (d) Following the third anniversary of the Closing, whether or not during the term of the Strategic Alliance, the SMBC Unit- Holders may sell up to 9,231 SMBC Units (i) prior to the IPO, with the consent of Moelis General Partner (which consent may not be unreasonably withheld),  provided such sale is not to a Moelis Competitor, or (ii) following the IPO, without restriction, subject only to applicable securities laws.
ollama_generated:
(i) Prior to the IPO, Moelis General Partner shall not have the right to unreasonably delay its consent to an SMBC Unit-Holder's transfer of all or a portion of the SMBC Units to any person who is not a competitor of Moelis, provided that such transfer does not require the approval of more than one-third of the remaining SMBC Unit-Holders.
   (ii) Following the IPO, any SMBC Unit-Holder may freely transfer the SMBC Units, subject only to applicable securities laws and with the consent of a majority of the remaining SMBC Unit-Holders in case the proposed transferee is a Moelis Competitor. However, this restriction will not apply if the number of SMBC Units held by the competitor after the transfer does not exceed 5% of the total issued and outstanding SMBC Units.

original: (e) During the term of the Strategic Alliance and prior to the IPO, Moelis Holdings shall notify SMBC in advance of publicly announcing the sale or issuance of any interests in Moelis Holdings (other than Management Units) to a Strategic Investor,  provided, that Moelis Holdings shall notify SMBC in advance only to the extent and in such manner as it is permissible under any confidentiality agreement entered into in connection with such sale or issuance.
ollama_generated: (e) Throughout the duration of the Strategic Alliance, prior to the IPO, SMBC shall be notified in advance by Moelis Holdings regarding any proposed sale or issuance of interests in Moelis Holdings (excluding Management Units), to a Strategic Investor. Notification will only be required if such disclosure is permissible under any confidentiality agreement executed in relation to the transaction at hand, with the understanding that Moelis Holdings maintains the right to determine and exercise discretion as to the extent and manner of its advance notification to SMBC.

original: (a) in the case of a Demand Registration pursuant to  Section 13.1 , priority will be (i) first, all Registrable Securities included in the Registration Statement, (ii) second, any Partnership Interests proposed to be offered by Moelis Holdings for its own account (iii) third,  pro rata among any other holders of Partnership Interests requested to be registered pursuant to a contractual right, and (iv) fourth,  pro rata among any other holders of Partnership Interests requested to be registered; (b) in the case of a registration statement initiated by Moelis Holdings for its own account that gives rise to a Piggyback Registration pursuant to  Section 13.2 , priority will be (i) first, Partnership Interests proposed to be offered by Moelis Holdings for its own account, (ii) second,  pro rata among all holders of Partnership Interests requested to be registered pursuant to a contractual right and (iii) third,  pro rata among any other holders of Partnership Interests requested to be registered; and (c) in the case of a registration statement initiated by Moelis Holdings for the account of holders (other than the SMBC Unit- Holders) of Partnership Interests, pursuant to registration rights afforded to such holders by contract, that gives rise to a Piggyback Registration pursuant to  Section 13.2 , priority will be (i) first,  pro rata among the holders of Partnership Interests for whose account the registration statement was initiated, (ii) second, Partnership Interests offered by Moelis Holdings for its own account, (iii) third,  pro rata among any other holders of Partnership Interests requested to be registered pursuant to a contractual right and (iv) fourth,  pro rata among any other holders of Partnership Interests requested to be registered.
modified:
(a) In the event of a Demand Registration under Section 13.1, the order of registration priority will be as follows: (i) first, all Registrable Securities included in the Registration Statement; (ii) second, any Partnership Interests offered by Moelis Holdings for its own account; (iii) fourth, pro rata among any other holders of Partnership Interests not covered under (i), (ii), or (iv); and (iv) third, pro rata among any other holders of Partnership Interests requested to be registered pursuant to a contractual right.

   (b) For a registration statement initiated by Moelis Holdings for its own account that triggers a Piggyback Registration under Section 13.2, the order will be: (i) first, Partnership Interests offered by Moelis Holdings for its own account; (ii) second, pro rata among all holders of Partnership Interests requested to be registered pursuant to a contractual right; and (iii) third, pro rata among any other holders of Partnership Interests not covered under (i) or (ii).

   (c) In the case of a registration statement initiated by Moelis Holdings for the account of holders (other than the SMBC Unit-Holders) of Partnership Interests, which triggers a Piggyback Registration under Section 13.2, the order will be: (i) first, pro rata among the holders of Partnership Interests for whose account the registration statement was initiated; (ii) second, Partnership Interests offered by Moelis Holdings for its own account; (iii) fourth, pro rata among any other holders of Partnership Interests not covered under (i), (ii), or (iv); and (iv) third, pro rata among any other holders of Partnership Interests requested to be registered pursuant to a contractual right.

In this revised version, the priority order for registration has been inverted for the cases where Moelis Holdings initiates the registration for its own account or for the account of certain holders, giving lower priority to its own offerings compared to the previous version.

original: 13.7  Market Stand-Off Agreement .
modified:
13.7 Market Obligatory Participation Agreement (Voluntary Basis):

This provision introduces a market participation agreement that is voluntary in nature for both parties. Each party, on its own accord, shall agree to offer or purchase securities, as designated by the other party, for the purpose of stabilizing market conditions, subject to applicable laws and regulations. The decision to participate or not shall be at the discretion of each party, with no obligation or liability incurred if a party chooses not to participate in any given instance. This agreement aims to promote a cooperative approach towards market management, while ensuring each party retains flexibility in its trading activities.

original: (a) In connection with any Underwritten Offering that is the IPO, or any Underwritten Offering in which the SMBC Unit-Holders are selling Registrable Securities pursuant to  Sections 13.1  or 13.2, each SMBC Unit-Holder agrees that, during the period of duration (up to 180 days, subject to customary extensions as may be required by the underwriter or underwriters up to a maximum of 214 days) specified by Moelis Holdings and the underwriter or underwriters of Registrable Securities, following the date of the final prospectus or other offering document distributed in connection with the Underwritten Offering, it shall not, to the extent requested by Moelis Holdings and such underwriter or underwriters, directly or indirectly, sell, offer to sell, contract to sell (including any short sale or other hedging transaction), grant any option to purchase or otherwise transfer any Registrable Securities held by it at any time during such period except for such Registrable Securities as shall be included in such registration. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the obligations described in this  Section 13.7(a)  shall not apply (i) to a registration relating solely to employee benefit plans on Form S-1 or Form S-8, (ii) to a registration relating solely to an acquisition or similar transaction on Form S-4 or (iii) unless all holders then holding more than 3% of the issued and outstanding Partnership Interests (and/or any securities of Moelis Holdings or any successor entity into which the Partnership Interests are converted, exchanged or redesignated) with a contractual obligation enforceable by Moelis Holdings or its affiliates to do so and all of the then-current executive officers and directors (if applicable) of Moelis Holdings enter into similar agreements.
ollama_generated:
(a) In relation to any Underwritten Offering, be it the IPO or an offering where SMBC Unit-Holders are selling Registrable Securities under Sections 13.1 or 13.2, each SMBC Unit-Holder accepts that, during a duration period (extendable up to 214 days from the date of the final prospectus or other offering document distributed in connection with the Underwritten Offering) as determined by Moelis Holdings and the underwriter(s) of Registrable Securities, they will not, upon request by Moelis Holdings or such underwriter(s), engage in any direct or indirect sale, offer to sell, contract for sale (including short sales or other hedging transactions), option grants, or transfer of any Registrable Securities held by them, except for those Registrable Securities included in the registration. However, this restriction shall not apply:

   (i) for a registration solely on Form S-1 or Form S-8 pertaining to employee benefit plans;
   (ii) for a registration exclusively related to an acquisition or similar transaction on Form S-4; and
   (iii) unless all holders of more than 3% of the issued and outstanding Partnership Interests (and/or any securities of Moelis Holdings or any successor entity into which the Partnership Interests are converted, exchanged or redesignated), who have a contractual obligation enforceable by Moelis Holdings or its affiliates to do so, and all then-current executive officers and directors (if applicable) of Moelis Holdings also agree to these terms.

original: 13.8  Registration Expenses . All fees and expenses incident to Moelis Holding’s performance of or compliance with the obligations of this ARTICLE XIII , including all fees and expenses incurred in complying with securities or “blue sky” laws, printing expenses, messenger and delivery expenses of Moelis Holdings, any registration or filing fees payable under any federal or state securities or “blue sky” laws, the fees and expenses incurred in connection with any listing or quoting of the securities to be registered on any national securities exchange or automated quotation system, fees of the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, fees and disbursements of counsel for Moelis Holdings, its independent registered certified public accounting firm and any other public accountants who are required to deliver comfort letters (including the expenses required by or incident to such performance), fees of transfer agents and registrars, costs of insurance, and the fees and expenses of other persons retained by Moelis Holdings, will be borne by Moelis Holdings;  provided, however; that the SMBC Unit-Holders shall pay all reasonable out-of-pocket expenses of Moelis Holdings (including, for the avoidance of doubt, all the fees set forth above in this section) in connection with the Demand Registration subject to Moelis Holdings’ obligations set forth in  Section 13.1(a)(i) . The SMBC Unit-Holders will bear and pay any fees and expenses of SMBC or its affiliates or their Representatives, including their counsel, and any underwriting discounts, fees and commissions and any transfer taxes applicable to Registrable Securities offered for its account pursuant to any Registration Statement.
modified: 13.8 Registration Expenses: The expenses related to Moelis Holding's fulfillment of the duties outlined in this ARTICLE XIII, including but not limited to costs associated with compliance with securities or "blue sky" laws, printing expenses, messenger and delivery expenses, registration or filing fees under any federal or state securities or "blue sky" laws, listing or quoting fees for the securities on national exchanges or automated quotation systems, Financial Industry Regulatory Authority fees, counsel fees for Moelis Holdings, its independent registered certified public accounting firm and any required public accountants (including costs associated with their comfort letters), transfer agent and registrar fees, insurance costs, and fees of other persons engaged by Moelis Holdings will be borne by the SMBC Unit-Holders, except for reasonable out-of-pocket expenses incurred by Moelis Holdings in connection with a Demand Registration, provided that this is consistent with Moelis Holding's obligations as outlined in Section 13.1(a)(i). The SMBC Unit-Holders will be responsible for all fees and expenses of SMBC or its affiliates, their Representatives (including their counsel), underwriting discounts, fees and commissions, and any transfer taxes applicable to Registrable Securities offered in accordance with a Registration Statement. This provision shifts the burden of expenses from Moelis Holdings to the SMBC Unit-Holders, except for certain specified circumstances, while still requiring the SMBC Unit-Holders to cover fees related to their own interests and affiliates.

original: (g) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, each of the Indemnified Parties has relied on this  Section 13.9 , is an express third party beneficiary of this  Section 13.9  and is entitled to enforce the obligations of the applicable Indemnified Parties under this Section 13.9  directly against such Indemnified Parties to the full extent thereof.
ollama_generated: (g) Despite any conflicting provisions within this Agreement, each of the Indemnifying Parties acknowledges that they have willingly waived their right to assert otherwise, and recognizes this Section 13.9 as a primary benefit conferred upon them. Consequently, the beneficiaries mentioned in this Section 13.9 are implied third-party beneficiaries, empowered to invoke the provisions of this Section 13.9 directly against the relevant Indemnifying Parties, but only to the extent that the Indemnifying Parties have obligations under this Section 13.9.

original: 14.2  Representations and Warranties of SMBC/Nikko . SMBC and Nikko each represent and warrant to Moelis Holdings and Moelis General Partner that:
ollama_generated:
14.2 Shared Representation and Assurances by SMBC/Nikko to Moelis Holdings and Moelis General Partner: In turn, SMBC and Nikko affirm, on their behalf and for the benefit of Moelis Holdings and Moelis General Partner, that they hold no misrepresentations or breaches of warranty concerning the following aspects:

This revised clause maintains the original meaning but shifts the obligation to affirm the absence of misrepresentations or breach of warranty from Moelis Holdings and Moelis General Partner (original clause) to SMBC and Nikko. This implies a slight weakening of responsibility for potential misstatements or breaches, as the burden now lies with the parties providing the representations and warranties (SMBC and Nikko).

original: MISCELLANEOUS 15.1  Expenses; No Partnership or Joint Venture . Each party will bear its own legal, marketing, travel and other expenses in connection with the Strategic Alliance. No party is the partner, joint venture partner or agent of any other party with power to bind any other party contractually.
modified: MISCELLANEOUS 15.2  Shared Expenses; Implied Partnership Implication Avoided. Each party shall share equally any extraordinary legal, marketing, travel, and other expenses incurred in relation to the Strategic Alliance. However, no partnership, joint venture, or agency relationship is implied between the parties, each remaining independent entities without power to contractually bind one another.

original: 15.8  Governing Laws; Jurisdiction . This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of New York without regard to principles of conflict of laws. The parties irrevocably and unconditionally submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of any state or Federal court sitting in Manhattan, New York over any suit, action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement. The parties hereby agree that service of any process, summons, notice or document by U.S. registered mail addressed to such party at the address above shall be effective service of process for any action, suit or proceeding brought in any such court. The parties irrevocably and unconditionally waive any objection to the laying of venue of any such suit, action or proceeding brought in any such court and any claim that any such suit, action or proceeding brought in such a court has been brought in an inconvenient forum. Each party waives any right to trial by jury with respect to any proceeding arising out of this Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, any matter relating to the SMBC Unit-Holders’ rights or obligations as Limited Partners of Moelis Holdings shall be subject to Sections 10.4 and 10.10 of the Moelis Holdings Agreement and not to this  Section 15.8 .
modified:
15.8 Governing Laws and Jurisdiction: This Agreement will be interpreted under the laws of the State of New York, disregarding any principles that might result from conflict-of-laws rules. The parties mutually consent to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of any state or Federal court located in Manhattan, New York for any dispute arising from or related to this Agreement. However, we both acknowledge and understand that service of process, summons, notice, or documents sent via U.S. registered mail to our respective addresses as stated above will suffice as valid service for any action, suit, or proceeding initiated in such a court.

Furthermore, the parties hereby reserve the right to object to the venue of any such lawsuit, action, or proceeding brought in any such court and assert that such legal proceedings are not brought in an inconvenient forum. Each party maintains the right to request a trial by jury with respect to any dispute arising out of this Agreement, unless otherwise specified in this Agreement or the Moelis Holdings Agreement (Sections 10.4 and 10.10). In the case of matters concerning the SMBC Unit-Holders' rights or obligations as Limited Partners of Moelis Holdings, they will be governed by Sections 10.4 and 10.10 of the Moelis Holdings Agreement rather than this Section 15.8.

original: 15.9  Effect on Prior Agreement . Commencing as of the Effective Date, the rights and obligations of the parties shall be determined pursuant to this Agreement and the Prior Agreement shall be of no further effect; provided, that, any fees and expenses due to a party outstanding thereunder shall be deemed to be outstanding under this Agreement.
modified: 15.9 Preeminence of Prior Agreement: As of the Effective Date, the rights and obligations of the parties will primarily stem from the Prior Agreement, unless specifically superseded by this Agreement. Concurrently, any fees or expenses due to a party under this Agreement that were initially due under the Prior Agreement shall continue to be considered outstanding debts owed under this Agreement. This implies that, moving forward, the Prior Agreement maintains its relevance and binding nature, with any unpaid fees and expenses from it being integrated into this Agreement's scope of obligations.

original: SUMITOMO MITSUI BANKING CORPORATION Name: Takeshi Kunibe Title: President SMBC NIKKO SECURITIES INC.
ollama_generated:
SUMITOMO MITSUI BANKING CORPORATION, represented by Takeshi Kunibe as its President, shall retain the discretionary authority to delegate certain responsibilities, if deemed necessary and appropriate, in connection with SMBC NIKKO SECURITIES INC.

This revised clause shifts some of the responsibility from the President of SMBC Nikko Securities Inc. to Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, allowing them discretionary authority to delegate certain responsibilities if they deem it necessary or appropriate.

original: (e) Partnership Interests . The issuance of Partnership Interests to SMBC pursuant to the Subscription Agreement has been duly authorized by all necessary action on the part of Moelis Holdings. When issued, delivered and sold against receipt of the consideration therefor as provided in the Subscription Agreement, such Partnership Interests will be validly issued, fully paid and nonassessable and without any personal liability attaching to the ownership thereof (except as provided for in the Moelis Holdings Agreement), will not be issued in violation of or subject to preemptive rights of any other unitholder of Moelis Holdings and will not result in the violation or triggering of any price-based antidilution adjustments under any agreement to which Moelis Holdings is a party. The issuance of Partnership Interests to SMBC qualifies as an issuance of “Additional Units” to a “Strategic Investor” under Section 3.4.1 of the Moelis Holdings Agreement for which existing Common Partners will not have the right of first refusal as provided therein.
ollama_generated: (e) Partnership Interests . The authorization for the issuance of Partnership Interests to SMBC, as outlined in the Subscription Agreement, has been duly executed by Moelis Holdings. Upon issue, delivery, and sale, in accordance with the consideration stipulated in the Subscription Agreement, these Partnership Interests will be considered validly issued, fully paid, and non-assessable, absolving the holder from any personal liability (beyond that defined in the Moelis Holdings Agreement). The issuance of these Partnership Interests to SMBC is not in violation of, or subject to, the preemptive rights of any other unitholder within Moelis Holdings. However, the issuance may result in potential price-based antidilution adjustments under agreements with which Moelis Holdings is associated, should such conditions arise. The issuance of Partnership Interests to SMBC falls under the category of "Additional Units" provided to a "Strategic Investor," as defined in Section 3.4.1 of the Moelis Holdings Agreement. Contrary to provisions stated therein, existing Common Partners will not be granted the right of first refusal for this issuance.

original: (f) No Conflicts . Neither the execution and delivery by the Moelis Entities of the Strategic Alliance Agreement or the Subscription Agreement, nor the consummation of the transactions contemplated thereby, nor compliance by the Moelis Entities with any of the provisions thereof, will violate any applicable law or regulation or violate, conflict with, or result in a breach of any provision of, or constitute a default (or an event which, with notice or lapse of time or both, would constitute a default) under, or result in the termination of, or result in the loss of any benefit or creation of any right on the part of any third party under, or accelerate the performance required by, or result in a right of termination or acceleration of, or result in the creation of any lien or encumbrance upon any of the material properties or assets of any of the Moelis Entities or any of their controlled affiliates under any of the terms, conditions or provisions of (i) their respective organizational documents or (ii) any note, bond, mortgage, indenture, deed of trust, license, lease, agreement or other instrument or obligation to which any of the Moelis Entities or any of their controlled affiliates is a party or by which it may be bound, or to which any of the Moelis Entities or any of their controlled affiliates or any of the properties or assets of any of the Moelis Entities or any of their controlled affiliates may be subject, except as would not reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on the Moelis Entities and their controlled affiliates, taken as a whole.
ollama_generated: (f) Limited Conflicts . The execution and delivery by the Moelis Entities of the Strategic Alliance Agreement or the Subscription Agreement, the consummation of the transactions contemplated thereby, and compliance by the Moelis Entities with any provisions thereof may potentially violate applicable laws or regulations or breach, conflict with, or create a right on the part of any third party under, or trigger an event which could lead to a default, termination, loss of benefit, or creation of a right, lien, encumbrance, or acceleration of performance under, any terms, conditions, or provisions of (i) their respective organizational documents or (ii) any note, bond, mortgage, indenture, deed of trust, license, lease, agreement, or other instrument or obligation to which any of the Moelis Entities or any of their controlled affiliates is a party or by which it may be bound, or to which any of the Moelis Entities or any of their controlled affiliates or any of the properties or assets of any of the Moelis Entities or any of their controlled affiliates may be subject. However, such potential violations, breaches, conflicts, or events shall not have a material adverse effect on the Moelis Entities and their controlled affiliates, taken as a whole, unless reasonably expected to do so.

original: (n) Litigation . None of the Moelis Entities or any of their controlled affiliates is a party to any, and there are no pending or, to the Moelis Entities’ knowledge, threatened, material legal, administrative, arbitral or other proceedings, claims, actions or governmental or regulatory investigations (i) of any nature against the Moelis Entities or any controlled affiliate except as would not reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on the Moelis Entities and their controlled affiliates, taken as a whole, or (ii) challenging the validity or propriety of the transactions contemplated by the Subscription Agreement. There is no material injunction, order, judgment, decree or regulatory restriction imposed upon the Moelis Entities, any controlled affiliate or any of their assets, except for regulatory restrictions of general application.

Neither the Moelis Entities nor any of their controlled affiliates is currently involved in, and there is no knowledge on the part of the Moelis Entities of any impending or threatened legal, administrative, arbitral, or other proceedings, claims, actions, or governmental or regulatory investigations (i) that could potentially impact the Moelis Entities or any controlled affiliate significantly, or (ii) that question the legality or propriety of the transactions outlined in the Subscription Agreement. However, it is acknowledged that minor disputes or regulatory restrictions of general application may exist and are not deemed material for this purpose. No material injunction, order, judgment, decree, or regulatory restriction has been imposed on the Moelis Entities, any controlled affiliate, or their assets, beyond those of a routine nature.

original: (p) Risk Management . The Moelis Entities and their controlled affiliates have in place risk management policies and procedures, of the type and in the form that the Moelis Entities and their controlled affiliates believe, in good faith, are sufficient in scope and operation to protect against risks of the type and in the form expected to be used by persons of similar size and in similar lines of business as such Moelis Entity or controlled affiliate.
modified: (q) Risk Mitigation. The Moelis Entities and their controlled affiliates adopt risk mitigation strategies, which they, in good faith, believe to be reasonably adequate for managing risks akin to those typically encountered by entities of comparable size and business nature. However, it should be noted that the effectiveness of these measures cannot guarantee complete protection against unforeseen or exceptional risks.

original: (r) Permanent Disability . To the knowledge of the Moelis Entities, (i) KM has not (A) suffered and is not currently suffering any physical or mental incapacity or disability, total or partial, that would constitute or would reasonably be expected to result in a Key Man Event (as such term is defined in the Moelis Holdings Agreement) or (B) been absent from work for three or more consecutive months at any time since the inception of the Moelis Entities and (ii) no other circumstance or condition exists that would constitute or would reasonably be expected to result in a Key Man Event. Since the inception of the Moelis Entities, no Key Man Event has occurred.
ollama_generated: (s) Potential Disability Considerations . To the best of the knowledge of the Moelis Entities, (i) KM does not have any existing or anticipated physical or mental conditions that could potentially lead to a significant reduction in their ability to perform their duties effectively as a Key Man, nor has KM been absent from work for more than one consecutive month at any point since the inception of the Moelis Entities. However, it is understood that temporary incapacitation or short-term absences may occur due to reasonable causes, and such events will not automatically constitute a Key Man Event provided they are not prolonged or recurrent. It is further acknowledged that should any circumstance or condition arise that could potentially result in KM's significant reduction in ability to perform their duties as a Key Man, the Moelis Entities shall be promptly informed and will evaluate the situation on a case-by-case basis. Since the inception of the Moelis Entities, no event has occurred that has led to a determination of a Key Man Event.
